If you guys could try to focus on his mid-game power spike, that would be *fantastic*.  For the Juggermaw comp to work, Kog *needs* a powerful mid game power spike.  If his team is going to hedge on Kog doing all their damage, that damage needs to be formidable by the time team fights and larger skirmishes are beginning in earnest.

Weak early, very strong mid, solid late (weaker than Twitch or Vayne but stronger than lane bullies) is the ideal success curve for Kog to let him do what he's supposed to do.

so if kogmaw cant out scale them late game, or just peak during mid game, he would just become a redundant hero as most adc get some sort of dmg spike during mid game

His early game could be improved as well, really.  As long as he isn't comparable in strength to the lane bullies he's fine on that front.

Different champions have different power curves.  Being an absolute monster with just one item (Trinity most recently, old Madred's if we look back further) meant that Kog could function as the damage centerpiece in a team that otherwise lacked damage.  He supplied enough to make up for everything else when he was working properly.  Ideally Kog's team would dominate the team fight phase and close the game out before the 40-45 minute mark when actual hyper-carries really start coming into their own.

With actual hyper-carries building your whole team around them is a terrible plan since they typically aren't game changing enough by mid-game.  In an organized setting, champs like Twitch and Vayne are more or less the back-up plan.  You draft a team with plenty of damage that can hold its own.  Hopefully you win the game before they kick in, but if the game stalls then you've basically got an auto-win once they hit a full item build.

And Kog has never been a hyper-carry.  Or at least ADC Kog isn't.  The fact that Riot keeps saying that only makes it clear that they don't really understand what makes Kog (or the Juggermaw comp) work.  If Riot wanted to totally cast aside the whole Juggermaw concept then yeah, sure, make Kog an actual hyper-carry.  Give him a new passive that allows his OnHit effects to crit and lifesteal.  That would be more than sufficient to give him an actual hyper-carry curve.

This is why I've been trying to strike up actual dialog with Riot on Kog.  There's a great deal of confusion over what he is and what he's supposed to be.  The two visions they keep describing for him (super late game scaler and Juggermaw) are mutually exclusive.  Unless, of course, they give him a super-powerful mid game and an even *stronger* late game.  But that would just net him nerfs.

I think the identity of kog is solely dependent on Riot... there is no "suppose to"..there is no "properly"...
